content.rendered:
Home of the sacred Ganges, Haridwar holds a tranquil charm during the night. Unlike the typical nightlife scene, Haridwar’s tourism does not revolve around parties, nightclubs, and bars. Haridwar offers a spiritually enriching experience to the soul. The evening Ganga Aarti ceremony, the sacred Ghats of the Ganges, flickering oil lamps, and the tranquil ambiance imbued with devotion make Haridwar a place for a spiritually enriched nightlife experience. Being one of the holiest Hindu pilgrimage places in India, Haridwar evokes a sense of spiritual connection and cultural immersion.

Here is a list of the top things to do in Haridwar for a wonderful nightlife experience:-

Cinema Halls in Haridwar

The largest shopping mall in Uttarakhand, the Pentagon Mall has all facilities for Cinema lovers, which provides a comfortable atmosphere to watch the latest releases with empty seats at cheap prices. The two other cinemas that are located in Haridwar are Chitra Cinemas and Motion Picture Theatre. The cinema theatres in Haridwar would provide all that you’ll pay for as some of the latest films could run in these outlets and it does have proper seating arrangements so much so, comfortable ones to enable viewers to enjoy their movies.

Amusement Parks in Haridwar

It also refers to Crystal World which is an amusement water park that offers myriads of entertainment to the entire family. This is a popular destination for those who are looking for some overtime fun. This park has great slides and swings along with other facilities where everyone from children to adults has an enjoyable time. Being a place of fun, this park gives escape to tourists who want to explore fun places in Haridwar. Families and tourists should relax from the hustle and bustle of Haridwar.

Har Ki Pauri at Night

As the sun sets and the evening descends, the Har Ki Pauri Ghat of Haridwar at night looks magical. You will see devotees sitting near the banks of the Ganga River and embracing the tranquil atmosphere. The soft glow of oil lamps transforms the setting into a realm of Bliss. This is the time when Ganga Aarti takes place and you will see priests perform prayers and offer lamps by chanting sacred hymns. The ambiance of devotion and tranquillity around you will give you a sense of peace and fulfillment at night.

Night Trek to Mansa Devi Temple

Night Trek to Mansa Devi Temple offers thrilling adventure experiences to tourists. As the sun sets, the trail to Ma Mansa Devi opens up a world of adventures. The sounds of nature and the sight of Sadhus surround you. Along the way, you will encounter many blissful night views of the Himalayan Mountains. The panoramic views of Haridwar and the sacred Ganges River below at night delight the soul. As soon as you reach the temple, Ma Mansa Devi showers her divine blessings upon you which makes the trek an unforgettable experience filled with wonder.

Night Safari in Haridwar

If you go 18 km further from the city of Haridwar, Rajaji Wildlife Sanctuary’s wildlife experience will take your breath away. You will see wild bears, civet cats, porcupines, jackals, elephants, and many other endangered species. The wildlife sanctuary showcases rich Himalayan floral and faunal species. Moreover, the charming views of the dense forests at night add a thrill to the trip. The night safari usually starts at 6:00 pm and lasts for 2 to 3 hours. You must book your Safari in advance to avoid any hassle.

Bazaars of Haridwar

The bazaars and markets of Haridwar come alive with a unique charm at night. You will get the most blissful views of the markets of Haridwar at night. There are many markets in Haridwar which capture the hearts of the tourists. You can stroll along the lively shops selling a variety of items like clothes, religious items, souvenirs and home decor products, jewellery, traditional items, and local handicrafts crafted by local artisans. Whether you are in search of souvenirs, street food, or simply soaking in the liveliness of the bustling bazaars, shopping is the best way to experience the local lifestyle of Haridwar.

Food of Haridwar

The street food of Haridwar Promises to tickle your taste buds. At night, Haridwar’s vibrant food stalls come alive to offer an amazing variety of street food to the tourists. If you venture into the heart of Haridwar’s old town, you will discover many hidden gems. Many amazing eateries and family-run restaurants are serving traditional Uttarakhand cuisine and North Indian delicacies to South Indian snacks. Treat yourself to Haridwar’s best eateries and try dishes like Paratha, Kachodi, Aloo Poori, Curry Chawal, Badam Milk, Lassi, Chole Bhature, Delicious Chaats, and Rabri-Halwa etc. These are some of the must-try dishes of Haridwar.
